content: keeping it separate from the unused scrappy balls this ensures that you don t use the same scrap colour too close to the last time it was used you repeat this method until your first bag/basket is empty and then you switch the bag/basket around and then yes you guessed it you simply start randomly selecting your colours again repeating the process you can have as many or as few colours as you like this also saves tons of time trying to choose colours that work together no more over thinking 😉 there is such a freeing feeling to just trust the process and randomly choose colours what is even more satisfying is the stunning surprise end result 😍 below you will find an estimated yarn quantity required for each scrappy yarn colour row and also the amount for the main colour so you can be prepared ahead most importantly have fun while making your very own one of a kind sassy scrappy beanie 2 the sassy scrappy beanie by off the hook creative ©2025 difficulty level medium materials required ● any dk yarn scraps i used crafty things 100% acrylic ● 4mm crochet hook ● stitch marker ● darning needle ● scissor ● pompom optional colour guide mc = main colour for the rib & alternating stripes of the head section rc = random colour random scrappy yarn selected crochet terms i have used us crochet terms chain = chain single_crochet = single_crochet decrease = single_crochet 2 together decrease = double_crochet 2 together sk1 = skip 1 stitch st s = stitch es blo = back loop only slip_stitch = slip_stitch beg = beginning rs = right side ws = wrong side sm = stitch marker #
